channel.title: general on Newsround
channel.description: Recent content in general on Newsround

item.title: Despite Greenland, France's Macron and NATO's head make nice with Trump behind the scenes - AP News
item.description: President Donald Trump has shared private messages from world leaders about Greenland, revealing softer tones behind public criticism. On Tuesday, Trump published a text from French President Emmanuel Macron, confirmed as genuine by the French leader’s office…

item.title: Letlow launches Trump-backed Senate bid against Cassidy - Politico
item.description: While Sen. Bill Cassidy has maintained he will win, Trump’s endorsement of Letlow is a particular blow.

item.title: Trump slams UK deal to hand over Chagos Islands after he previously backed it - AP News
item.description: The British government is defending its decision to transfer sovereignty of the Chagos Islands to Mauritius after U.S. President Donald Trump criticized the move. Trump called it an act of stupidity on Tuesday, He argued that it weakens national security. He …

item.title: California wildfire smoke exposure during pregnancy linked to autism risk in children - NBC News
item.description: Pregnant women’s exposure to wildfire smoke — particularly in the third trimester — may increase the risk of autism in their children, according to new research.

item.title: DOJ civil rights chief blasts Don Lemon for covering anti-ICE protest inside church, vows charges against protesters - NBC News
item.description: The Justice Department “will pursue charges” related to a protest inside a St.

item.title: Israeli crews begin bulldozing headquarters of UN agency for Palestinian refugees in East Jerusalem - AP News
item.description: Israeli forces have targeted two United Nations facilities as part of their crackdown on the U.N. agency for Palestinian refugees. On Tuesday, crews bulldozed the United Nations Relief and Works Agency’s offices in Sheikh Jarrah and fired tear gas at a vocati…

item.title: Trump’s a T-Rex and ‘pathetic’ leaders need to confront him, rages California’s Newsom - politico.eu
item.description: Leading Democrat launches broadside at politicians who bow to Trump: “You mate with him or he devours you, one or the other, and you need to stand up to it.”

item.title: 100 vehicles pile up in Michigan crash as snowstorm moves across the country - ABC News
item.description: More than 100 vehicles smashed into each other or slid off the interstate in Michigan as snow fueled by the Great Lakes blanketed the state

item.title: Britain approves ‘mega’ Chinese embassy in London despite national security fears - CNN
item.description: Britain’s government has green-lit plans for China to build a “mega” embassy close to London’s financial district, despite warnings from lawmakers, residents and Chinese dissidents-in-exile that the sprawling complex could pose security risks.

item.title: Pardoned Jan. 6 rioter Andrew Johnson to face criminal trial for child molestation - CBS News
item.description: Andrew Johnson is the latest in a series of pardoned Jan. 6 riot defendants to face new criminal charges.

item.title: Private credit is Wall Street's hottest trade. Now it's coming for your 401(k) - Business Insider
item.description: Wall Street giants like Apollo and Blackstone are all in on private credit — and it soon may end up in your retirement account.

item.title: Trump threatens 200% tariff on French wines as Macron reportedly snubs 'Board of Peace' seat - CNBC
item.description: Trump also reiterated his plans to control Greenland, saying that European leaders “won’t push back too much.”

item.title: In San Antonio, the nation's largest MLK march takes on added meaning - Texas Public Radio | TPR
item.description: The nation’s largest Martin Luther King Jr. Day march carries special significance in San Antonio, where a small Black community helped build a tradition that now draws hundreds of thousands each year.

item.description: Flying home this month from an extended Christmas vacation in Palm Beach, President Donald Trump was momentarily taken aback when a reporter asked him about the ice-covered island he’s openly trying to annex.

item.description: China Inc.’s biggest move into North America yet has industry officials and politicians on edge. But affordability concerns take center stage.

item.title: Updates: Denmark, Greenland float NATO mission on island - dw.com
item.description: Denmark’s defense minister said he and Greenland’s defense minister raised the possibility of a NATO surveillance mission in Greenland in a meeting with the NATO chief Mark Rutte.

item.description: A powerful flare has unleashed a severe solar storm that could cause auroras and satellite disruptions on Earth.

item.description: The video shows burglars slicing into display cases under the eyes of several Louvre Museum staff members who do not intervene.

item.description: “Our folks want to do more than just mass mobilization,” one organizer said.

item.description: A judge and his wife were shot and wounded in their home over the weekend in Lafayette, Indiana.

item.description: The computer engineer and avid bicyclist said he’s happy working behind the scenes to support his wife and Virginia’s new governor, Abigail Spanberger.

item.description: A who’s who of heads of state, top CEOs and tech pioneers are landing in Davos for the 2026 World Economic Forum meeting. But some big names aren’t going.

item.description: Oregon quarterback Dante Moore is returning to school, forcing the Jets to change directions at the top of this 2026 NFL mock draft.

item.title: Wildfires race across Chile, leaving 18 dead and forcing thousands to flee - AP News

item.title: Erie County issues a travel advisory as major winter storm approaches - WGRZ
item.description: Erie County will be under a Travel Advisory starting at 10 tonight as a long-duration winter storm moves into the region.

item.title: Trump urges lawmaker to challenge GOP senator who voted to convict him - The Washington Post
item.description: The president endorsed Rep. Julia Letlow of Louisiana, who hasn’t announced a Senate run. Sen. Bill Cassidy voted convict in the impeachment trial over the Jan. 6 riot.

item.description: Trump has said he wants the territory because of its strategic location. Maps show how a melting Arctic is affecting geopolitics.

item.description: “Highpointers” are people with a quirky goal: summiting the highest point in each of the 50 states, from Mr. McKinley in Alaska (elevation: 20,310 feet above sea level), to Florida’s Britton Hill (elevation: 345 feet).

item.title: German Soldiers Leave Greenland After 44 Hours, Bild Reports - Bloomberg.com
item.description: The German military reconnaissance team that arrived in Greenland on Friday is on its way back after a 44-hour deployment on the Arctic island, Bild newspaper reported on Sunday.

item.title: 1,500 soldiers on standby for possible Minnesota deployment, source says, as state mobilizes National Guard - CNN
item.description: The Pentagon has ordered about 1,500 active-duty soldiers to prepare for possible deployment to Minnesota, according to a Trump administration source, as state officials have also mobilized the National Guard.

item.title: Seahawks thump 49ers in playoff opener, advance to NFC Championship Game - The Seattle Times
item.description: In a game that felt over almost as soon as it started, the Seahawks thumped the 49ers 41-6 in their playoff opener and advance to the NFC Championship Game.

item.description: ‘SNL’ mocked President Trump’s egomania around the Nobel Peace Prize and Kristi Noem’s response to the ICE shooting in Minneapolis in its cold open.

item.title: Pennsylvania woman's final moments captured on home security video. Will it help prove she was murdered? - CBS News
item.description: Bruno Rocuba claims a freak accident while handling his gun caused the death of his wife, Melissa Rocuba. He was not arrested or charged with any crime. Years later, investigators uncover disturbing new evidence that challenges what really happened that night…

item.description: “If he wants us to deal with Gaza, it will have to be our way.”

item.description: The right-wing provocateur known for incendiary rhetoric and his 10 or so supporters were outnumbered by a large crowd of counterprotesters in Minneapolis.

item.description: Kyiv faces up to 20 hours without electricity each day after relentless Russian strikes, yet residents are finding creative ways to cope with the blackout.
